about.intro: Mirlo provides a user-friendly space to help musicians sell music, manage subscriptions, and share with their supporters.
about.missionStatement: <1>The music industry does not work for musicians or listeners and needs a radical re-imagination. </1><1>Mirlo is a community of musicians, listeners, and coders who are daring to do just that: taking lessons learned in working in the solidarity economy and applying them to our process and product.</1><1>We are building an online audio distribution (think Bandcamp) and patronage (think Patreon) platform that aims to be radical, accessible, open source (free & libre), modular, and standards based.</1>
about.behindThePlatformText: Our members have experience working both within Resonate and Ampled, other co-ops across several industries, and complex high-traffic web platforms. We envision this platform as a tool to support musicians in cultivating direct and reciprocal relationships and resources to sustain one another’s creative practice.

home.support: Directly support musicians. Buy their music. Collectively owned and managed.
home.sustainedBy: Mirlo's work is sustained by our community, not by venture capital
home.mirloConstruction:
Wanna talk more? E-mail us, join our Discord, or join us for office hours! Also check out our About page, FAQ, and the code on GitHub.

Want to just receive our monthly newsletter? Sign up

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.faqDescription: Some frequently asked questions about MirloThe people doing it
faq.questions.whatIsMirlo.question: What is Mirlo?
faq.questions.whatIsMirlo.answer: Mirlo provides a user-friendly space to help musicians sell music, manage subscriptions, and share with their supporters.
faq.questions.howDoesMirloWork.question: How does Mirlo work?
faq.questions.howDoesMirloWork.answer: Mirlo allows musicians to set up pages to host their music and set up tiers of monthly support. Fans can then purchase those albums or support musicians through monthly payments and get updates from them when they post on Mirlo.
faq.questions.howMuchDoesMirloCost.question: How much does Mirlo cost?
faq.questions.howMuchDoesMirloCost.answer: We’re exploring a number of funding structures. We’re aiming for musicians to get as much of the price of their albums and subscriptions as possible while still supporting the workers and infrastructure of the co-op. We will likely add ways for purchasers to support the platform directly.
faq.questions.whatMakesMirloDifferent.questi: What makes Mirlo different from other products?
faq.questions.whatMakesMirloDifferent.answer: Mirlo allows for direct and ongoing support of artists. It’s different from other crowdfunding platforms because it:
is rooted in mutual aid and an explicitly anti-capitalist and anti-oppressive practice;
is stewared by a worker co-op, which intends to exit-to-community as a multi-stakeholder cooperative;
It’s open source and is working together with other similar products to build towards a standard-based and sustainable ecosystem.
faq.questions.longTermGoals.question: What are the long term goals of Mirlo?
faq.questions.longTermGoals.answer: We believe that the community is the platform and our goals, informed by our <1>Observations and Intent</1>, will grow and change along with the community. That said, we would like to make it easier for other groups (like music labels or other co-ops) to install the software. We’d also like to look into building plug-ins and other tools that are useful for artists (for example, plug-ins that help to make your music available on aggregators like Distrokids or other platforms).
faq.questions.shortTermGoals.question: What are the short term goals of Mirlo?
faq.questions.shortTermGoals.answer: We’d like to release a minimum viable product that allows Artists to sell digital music in a few file formats People to become “patrons” of artists Compensate workers who are contributing to Mirlo's success To cover costs, we would aim to initially take a fairly small cut (if at all) via tips and patronage via our page on the platform (maybe with some fundraising releases).
faq.questions.mainBlockers.question: What are the main blockers facing Mirlo?
faq.questions.mainBlockers.answer: Our main blocker is getting the word out! If you want to help out with marketing, <1>please reach out</1>!
faq.questions.productRoadmap.question: What’s on your product roadmap?
faq.questions.productRoadmap.answer: We’re pretty close to being done with our minimum viable platform. Check out our <1>GitHub issues tracker</1> for what we're working on
faq.questions.heardOfProjectX.question: Have you heard of "project x"?
faq.questions.heardOfProjectX.answer: Probably! As individuals we’ve worked with and in Resonate and Ampled, and we’re in touch with a couple of other projects that are doing very similar things like jam.coop, faircamp, ampwall, patrontape, tone.audio, and some others. We’re hoping to continue talking to these folks and build towards standardization of resources and tech APIs so that our services can talk to each other and musicians can easily switch between them. If there’s a project you want to talk about, bring it up in our <1>Discord</1>!
faq.questions.howDoPayoutsWork.question: How do payouts work?
faq.questions.howDoPayoutsWork.answer: We use Stripe to process payments. Artists will have to create an account with Stripe, linking their bank account or debit card to the service to receive payouts. Then as users purchase their albums or subscribe to them, this money will be sent directly to their Stripe account.
faq.questions.howAreYouStructured.question: How are you structured?
faq.questions.howAreYouStructured.answer: Mirlo is currently a collective of people. We're incorporated as an LLC in Washington DC, and are working on an operating agreement for a worker-owned co-op. We’re a part of Fun Music Place, which is a community having wider conversations about the music industry. We will be a part of the US Federation of Worker Cooperatives when we’re done. As the product grows and proves to be sustainable we’re aiming to <1>Exit to Community</1>.
faq.questions.howAreDecisionsMade.question: How are decisions made?
faq.questions.howAreDecisionsMade.answer: Mirlo is maintained by a worker co-operative heavily rooted in a community of musicians and other interested people. Every feature on the platform is developed with input and insights from the community.
faq.questions.howCanIGetInTouch.question: How can I get in touch?
faq.questions.howCanIGetInTouch.answer: Our community is primarily hanging out on the <1>Discord</1> of our parent project <2>Fun Music Place</2>. Come say hi!
faq.questions.areYouOpenSource.question: Are you open source?
faq.questions.areYouOpenSource.answer: Yes! And we want your help 🙂. <1>Check out our code</1>.
faq.questions.canIHelpWithTesting.question: Can I help with testing?
faq.questions.canIHelpWithTesting.answer: Yes please! Reach out to either LLK or Si on the <1>Discord</1> to get started.
